抽.definition: to draw out; to pull out from in between; to remove part of the whole; (of certain plants) to sprout or bud; to whip or thrash

抽中.definition: to win (a prize in a lottery)

抽動.definition: to twitch; to throb; a spasm; to divert (money) to other uses

抽取.definition: to extract; to remove; to draw (a sales commission, venom from a snake etc)

抽打.definition: to whip; to flog; to thrash

抽插.definition: to slide in and out; thrusting

抽時間.definition: to (try to) find the time to

抽查.definition: random inspection; to do a spot check

抽水.definition: to pump water; (coll.) to shrink in the wash

抽煙.definition: to smoke (tobacco) (variant of 抽菸|抽烟[chou1yan1])

抽獎.definition: to draw a prize; a lottery; a raffle

抽痛.definition: to throb with pain; throbbing pain; twang; pang; CL:陣|阵[zhen4]

抽稅.definition: to tax; to levy a tax

抽空.definition: to find the time to do sth

抽筋.definition: cramp; charley horse; to pull a tendon

抽籤.definition: to perform divination with sticks; to draw lots; a ballot (in share dealing)

抽絲剝繭.definition: lit. to unwind the silk thread from the cocoon (idiom); fig. to unravel a mystery; to painstakingly follow the clues to eventually get to the bottom of the matter

抽號.definition: to randomly select (as for a lottery); to take a number (for queuing)

抽血.definition: to take blood; to draw blood (e.g. for a test)

抽身.definition: to get away from; to withdraw; to free oneself

抽離.definition: to remove; to step back from involvement; to disengage

抽頭.definition: to take a percentage of the winnings (in gambling); tap (in an electromagnetic coil); drawer (of a desk etc)

抽風.definition: to ventilate; to induce a draft; spasm; convulsion

抽驗.definition: to test a random sample; to spot-check
